title: Junior Software Engineer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Spectator Sports, and Entertainment Providers
description:
**Build smart tooling and automation that makes a BIG difference for the Toptracer business** 




  





**WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?** 




  





**Our mission** 
 is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ⛳️ 📺 🎥
 



  





**At our new office** 
 , you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful as we undergo exciting changes and growth. We are committed to creating an environment where you can grow professionally and individually. As well as creating a social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! 🥳 🏓 ☕️
 



  





**We are proud** 
 to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation! 🚀 💻 💙
 



  





**THE ROLE** 




 The team is now looking for a Junior Software Engineer with a broad background in software development, you will be driving technical decisions within the team and taking an active part in the company’s overall architectural and strategic discussions around ensuring scalability and enabling growth. Day-to-day you will be writing code with the team.
 



  





**THE TEAM** 




 The Orchestration Team at Toptracer develops scalable software to enhance operations, efficiency, and productivity. We aim to expand Toptracer Range locations with robust, scalable software, leveraging Kubernetes, observability tools, and standardized OS for servers and edge devices. We automate provisioning for physical and virtual servers and network devices.
 



 As we tackle automation challenges, you'll play a key role in technical decisions, architecture, and strategy while staying hands-on with the code. Join us to shape the software architecture of an innovative tech company alongside a passionate, diverse team.
 



  





**TECH STACK** 



* AWS and Docker for running and hosting backends and API’s
* Python for backend and general application development
* Flask for API development
* Kubernetes for orchestration and application environment
* Angular and React for web frontend
* PostgreSQL for database
* Bash for general scripting
* Linux for dev as well as prod environments.



 (All of the technologies mentioned above are not required to apply for the role)
 



  





**POSSIBILITIES** 



* Work in an autonomous team with competent, engaged, driven and creative colleagues who are great collaborators
* Build smart tooling and automation that makes a BIG difference for the business
* Drive architectural decisions at team level
* Build relationships with many teams, both in operations and in development
* Broad understanding of Toptracer’s technology
* Be part of a team and organization that embraces change
* Enable Toptracer’s world-leading technology to grow and deliver more FUN to the world!



  





**WE BELIEVE YOU** 



* Have experience in software development and a strong willingness to learn in a collaborative environment.
* Have basic experience or understanding of deploying and maintaining cloud-based and distributed systems.
* Have some familiarity with AWS and an interest in learning to build CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Gitlab) for Linux environments.
* Are curious about understanding how large systems and their components integrate.
* Have some experience in backend programming (e.g., Python with Flask/Django/FastAPI) and are motivated to enhance your skills.
* Are comfortable working in an agile environment and open to feedback.
* Are enthusiastic about learning software architecture while enjoying hands-on coding tasks.
* Are motivated to contribute to architectural discussions and decisions as you develop your expertise, helping the team manage architecture effectively.



  





**MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER** 




  





**Workplace** 




  





 We value fully engaged associates who come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing.
 



  





 In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.
 



  





**Culture** 




 Our culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence.
 



  





**Activities** 



* After-work
* Pair/Mob programming
* Conference
* Dart
* Gym sessions
* Table-tennis
* Golf simulator
* Golf tournaments



  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects.
* Collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* A hybrid work environment with the primary workplace at our cozy and welcoming office in Mörby Centrum, Danderyd.
* And of course, play golf!



  





 The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Stockholm. We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Development at Nolimit City (part of Evolution AB) is a challenging and exciting role where you will be part of a team dedicated to creating solutions that redefine our industry. By working in small, highly collaborative teams, you and your team will have clear ownership of one of our most important new initiatives.
   

  

 At Nolimit City, we optimize for quality, fast flows, and iterative development with short feedback loops. We have a strong focus on end-to-end ownership, continuous improvement, monitoring, and experimentation. We strive to have teams that are inclusive, helpful, and have a strong sense of ownership for what they build. Our engineers make some of the most significant decisions for the company, and we are looking for open and curious developers. As part of the Nolimit City team, you will be part of one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and contribute to creating value for our players worldwide.
   

  

 We are expanding several of our engineering teams, including the team working on new initiatives with innovative products for our end users and work on our core products.
   

  

 Although we prefer that you're working on-site we also undertand that you have a life outside of work, meaning that working remote from time to time, leaving early, coming in late etc is not something unusual for us. A bit of a cliche; but we do in fact offer a great deal of freedom but with that comes responsibility.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Own the product from start to finish. Decide how it is best built, tested, deployed, and monitored.
* Work with large-scale, highly available, and robust modern systems.
* Be an integral part of a team and its culture and ways of working.
* Work with automated deployment enabling release multiple times a day.
* Succeed, fail, and learn together with other competent and talented people. We believe in an environment that offers growth opportunities and see education as a result of failure that brings us closer to the next breakthrough.
* Take responsibility for system design, work together with domain architects, own end-to-end problems, manage stakeholder communication, and mentor junior engineers.


 Who you are
   

  

* Tech stack should include: JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, React, Java.
* Experience with advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks
* Experience with APIs and product development
* A passion for writing clear and sustainable code
* Experience with agile methodologies, continuous integration, continuous delivery
* Good spoken and written English skills
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* We understand that you might not have experience in all the areas listed above, but as long as you have the ambition and willingness to learn we would like to hear from you.


 Some of our technologies
   

  

* Javascript / TypeScript
* React / NextJS
* Redux / Redux-Toolkit Query
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Node.js and Express.js
* Java 17, Dropwizard
* MySQL
* PostgreSQL
* AWS, Ubuntu, Docker, GitHub Actions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Junior Software Engineer (framtida CTO) - Deltid, endast equity
description:
🧠 Spyrely söker en Junior Software Engineer (framtida CTO) – deltid, endast equity
   

  

 Är du en ambitiös utvecklare som vill vara med från början och bygga något på riktigt? Vill du växa in i en CTO-roll och samtidigt vara med och forma ett techbolag i tidigt skede?
   

  

 Spyrely är en early-stage startup som automatiserar konkurrentbevakning för små och medelstora företag. Vi hjälper bolag att följa sina konkurrenters nyheter, kampanjer, produktlanseringar och rekryteringar – enkelt, automatiskt och datadrivet.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en Junior Software Engineer – en smart, driven person som är i slutet av sina studier eller har 1–3 års erfarenhet, och som vill bygga något från grunden tillsammans med oss.
   

  

 👤 Vem du är:
   

 – Sista året civilingenjörstudent eller har 1–3 års relevant erfarenhet
   

 – Gärna teknisk utbildning (t.ex. datateknik, IT, teknisk fysik eller motsvarande)
   

 – Du har byggt egna projekt eller varit del i mindre utvecklingsteam
   

 – Du gillar produktutveckling, problemlösning och att ta ansvar
   

 – Du vill arbeta nära affären och påverka både teknik och strategi
   

 – Du har ambitionen att växa in i en CTO-roll över tid
   

  

 💻 Vad du kommer göra:
   

 – Vidareutveckla vår första version av plattformen
   

 – Utforska och välja rätt teknisk infrastruktur för framtiden
   

 – Samarbeta med grundarna för att prioritera rätt features och bygga MVP:er
   

 – Lägga grunden för ett techteam och leda utvecklingen på sikt
   

  

 🎁 Vad vi erbjuder:
   

 – En medgrundarroll med equity – du blir delägare
   

 – En plats vid beslutsbordet – du påverkar hela bolagets utveckling
   

 – En tydlig väg till CTO-roll och möjlighet att bygga ett team runt dig
   

 – Flexibla arbetstider, deltid och remote-vänligt
   

 – Möjlighet att bygga något meningsfullt i en tydlig marknad med konkret behov
   

  

 🌱 Varför Spyrely?
   

 Konkurrentbevakning är idag manuellt, dyrt och ineffektivt. Spyrely gör det automatiserat, strukturerat och tillgängligt – något många bolag behöver, men få löser bra idag. Vi bygger för verkliga användare och riktiga behov.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Bannerflow is a hyper-growth company and one of Europe's most exciting SaaS companies. We build a Creative Management Platform that allows enterprise brands to create, publish, analyze, and optimize advertising in-house, at scale and across advertising channels.
   

  

 Our agile teams are highly autonomous, collaborative and we are now looking for yet another passionate engineer to join us!
   

  

 ⭐
 **Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer:**
 At Bannerflow, we build flexible and autonomous teams based on trust. We believe that when people are given the freedom to take ownership and work closely together, great things happen. Our engineering culture is shaped by openness, respect, and a shared drive to keep improving.
   

  

 We are passionate about solving real problems and making a meaningful impact, and we are always open to exploring new ideas. With us, you will be part of a growing tech company where ideas are valued, feedback is encouraged, and personal development is supported. We bring the energy of a fast-moving company together with the stability of a proven product and a strong customer base.
   

  

 You will join a team where motivation is high, knowledge is shared openly, and having fun is part of everyday life — whether it’s through hackathons, board game nights, or spontaneous team activities.
   

  

**Our Ever Evolving Tech Stack Currently Consists Of**
* TypeScript / Angular
* C# / .NET
* MongoDB
* Azure & Kubernetes
* …and some more stuff


 🦋 Are you + Bannerflow = true?
   

  

 We are seeking an experienced and ambitious engineer to join our team and help us continue to deliver the best possible products to our customers. This role is a critical part of our development team and will play a key role in shaping the direction of our technology and ensuring that our products are robust, scalable and secure.
   

  

 So, what are we looking for?
   

  

* >5 years of experience as a software engineer delivering high-quality products
* Strong sense of ownership and personal drive
* Ability to write clean, efficient, and well-documented code
* Excellent communication, collaboration and leadership skills - paring or mobbing fellow developer is just a natural way of working for you
* Passion for mentoring and coaching team members to help them reach their full potential
* Strong interest of the latest technologies, industry trends and best practices to continually improve our products and processes


 At Bannerflow, we live our values of passion, collaboration and challenge in everything we do — from how we build software to how we celebrate success together. As a Software Engineer, you will play a key role in shaping the future of Ad Tech through innovative technology and product excellence. We offer a hybrid work setup, competitive compensation including ITP1 pension, health allowance, parental leave top-up and private health care insurance. We are also deeply committed to building a diverse and inclusive team, welcoming applicants from all backgrounds, experiences and abilities. If you are ready to grow, learn and make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 📌As we’re currently enjoying the Swedish summer, we’ll begin reviewing applications in August. Thanks for your patience!

title: Senior Dotnet Developer
description:
We're working with a fast-growing, product-focused tech company based in Stockholm that is looking to hire a Senior .NET Developer. This is a hybrid role, requiring a few days per week in their central Stockholm office. The team builds scalable backend systems that support a high-traffic, global user base, and they're looking for someone with a strong technical foundation who can contribute to long-term architectural decisions while remaining hands-on in daily development. All communication is in English, and the working environment is highly international.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* 6+ years of professional experience with .NET (C#, .NET Core/.NET 6+)
* Solid experience building and maintaining APIs and microservices
* Strong knowledge of SQL and relational databases such as PostgreSQL or SQL Server
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms, ideally Azure
* Familiarity with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and version control (Git)
* Comfortable working in a hybrid model with 2–3 days onsite in Stockholm
* Excellent communication skills in English



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Experience working in a product-led or consumer-facing company
* Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, or other containerisation technologies
* Interest or background in telecoms, mobile services, or payments

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Internet Marketplace Platforms, and Software Development
description:
**About Us** 




  





 Barnebys Group AB is the world’s leading ecosystem for art, antiques, and collectables. Founded in Stockholm in 2011, we have established a global presence with offices in Stockholm and the UK, covering 8 different markets; US, UK, Sweden, France, Germany, Spain, Italy, and Hong Kong. Our clients include the world’s leading auction houses as well as regional and local businesses.
 



 Barnebys offers a search service with 600,000+ items for sale, an extensive database of auction results, and a white-label auction system. While these services are core to Barnebys, this role is focused on the platform that powers our highly valuable
 **Traffic business** 
 . Built with technologies like
 **React, NextJS, TypeScript, Python, PHP, Kubernetes, and MySQL** 
 (with the intention to develop more backend services using
 **C#/Java** 
 instead of
 **NodeJS** 
 ). This platform ensures scalability and reliability.
 



 In this role, you’ll play a key part in shaping the future of this platform, driving innovation and improvements as we continue to grow and expand our capabilities.
 



 We are looking for a hands-on engineering lead who is comfortable with architecting the next phase of Barnebys as well as developing and deploying it for real world use.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




  




* Play a key role in attracting, developing and retaining top engineering talent
* Leverage your experience and establish best practices in software development, architecture, and DevOps
* Be hands-on—balance strategic direction with hands-on development of new products and solutions by contributing directly to the codebase
* Champion AI from day-to-day operations to building innovative AI products solving real customer problems
* Influence product priorities and scope by working with product, design and other teams
* Be responsible for the overall planning, execution and delivering within agreed timelines



  





**Who You Are** 




  





 We believe you have at least
 **8 years of hands-on experience** 
 as a developer, with expertise in several of the following areas:
 


* Confident working across frontend, backend, and infrastructure
* Curious, pragmatic, and always looking for smarter and efficient ways to deliver value to our customers and the organisation
* Someone who ‘Gets stuff done’ by demonstrating ownership and being proactive
* Have excellent people skills and have either led engineering teams or you are ready to take the next step in your career
* Skilled with Front-end technologies like React, NextJS, and modern CSS tools like SASS or TailwindCSS
* Have a strong knowledge of Back-end and APIs and technologies like C#/Java, NodeJS, Python, or frameworks like FastAPI, Flask, Express
* Work confidently with MySQL, Redis, and data tools like BigQuery
* Familiar with Docker, Kubernetes, and cloud platforms like Azure, GCP
* Experienced with CI/CD pipelines
* Understand queue systems such as LavinMQ, Service Bus, or RabbitMQ



  





**Bonus** 
 : Mobile app development, Google Analytics, SEO, Google Tag Manager
 



  





**What We Offer** 




  




* A chance to work with modern technologies on impactful projects
* An opportunity to directly shape the company’s future
* A supportive, innovative team that values your contributions
* Personal and professional growth in a collaborative environment
* Ability to build a high-performing team
* Other benefits



  





**What We Value** 




  





 Personality is as important as competence. We seek pragmatic, solution-oriented individuals who can deliver high-quality, adaptable code that drives value without unnecessary complexity. Taking initiative, offering thoughtful proposals, and embracing a team-first mindset are key.
 



  





 This is a hybrid role with a minimum of 3 days in the office. We are based in Östermalmstorg.

title: Python Developer
company_industry: Computer and Network Security and Technology, Information and Media
description:
Python Developer required to join a fast-scaling technology business backed by a global platform, currently looking to expand a specialist unit of engineers.
 



  





 This elite team of engineers operates like a start-up, combining deep technical expertise with the agility needed to build a next-generation platform capable of processing millions of data events annually. They’re creating intelligent, real-time user experiences using advanced analytics, cloud-native development, and high-performance systems.
 



  





 If you're excited by the idea of bridging the gap between engineering and data science, and want to build systems that deliver intelligent, responsive user journeys, this is a unique opportunity to make your mark.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As part of this team, you’ll sit at the intersection of software engineering and quantitative modelling-ensuring machine learning models and algorithms are efficiently deployed, scaled, and maintained in production cloud environments.
 



  





 You'll be contributing to a team where you can influence both product and technical decisions, working on complex challenges involving real-time data, personalisation engines, and distributed cloud systems.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Develop and maintain scalable, cloud-native microservices using Python and AWS.
* Build and improve CI/CD pipelines, containerized environments, and automated testing systems.
* Work closely with engineers and data scientists to integrate and optimise machine learning models.
* Contribute to technical design discussions, code reviews, and system architecture improvements.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics or a similar field (PhD in Mathematics is a plus).
* Strong proficiency in Python
* 5+ years of experience working on high-performance, data-driven software systems.

**Why Join?** 



* Be part of a highly autonomous, innovation-focused engineering team.
* Work on impactful AI and data-driven projects at scale.
* Backed by a global business while retaining the pace and culture of a startup.

title: Game Developer Intern
description:
**About the Internship** 





 Are you passionate about game development and excited to contribute to a next-gen, AI-powered shooter game?
 




  






 Realdini Studios is looking for Game Developer Interns who are eager to gain hands-on experience using Unreal Engine 5 and want to play a role in shaping a visually stunning and narratively rich multiplayer game. This is an excellent opportunity to grow your skills, collaborate with a creative team, and build your portfolio with real-world development experience.
 




  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Work directly in Unreal Engine 5 to develop core gameplay mechanics, multiplayer systems, and AI integrations.
* Collaborate with artists, designers, and AI specialists to bring game features to life.
* Use GitHub for version control and team-based collaboration.
* Optimize game systems for performance and player experience.
* Participate in regular brainstorming and sprint meetings to help shape the game's direction.



  





**Must-Have Skills** 



* Knowledge of Unreal Engine 5 and Blueprint scripting.
* Familiarity with interfaces and how to implement them within game systems.
* Basic understanding of game mechanics, physics, and AI behaviours.
* A strong desire to learn and contribute to real-world game development projects.
* Ability to work collaboratively within a creative and dynamic team.
* Familiarity with GitHub and version control best practices.



  





**Nice-to-Haves** 



* Experience integrating AI or procedural storytelling features.
* Exposure to multiplayer networking and replication in UE5.
* Background in game design, UI, or VFX.



  





**What We Offer** 



* A chance to work on a ground-breaking multiplayer shooter game from the early stages.
* Portfolio-building opportunities with real contributions to a functioning game project.
* A flexible, remote-friendly internship built around your availability.
* Mentorship and collaboration with game artists, developers, and designers.
* Workshops to help you grow and improve your technical and creative skills.
* A Certificate of Completion and professional reference upon successful participation.



  





**Important Note** 





 🚨 This is an unpaid internship focused on skill enhancement, professional growth, and portfolio development at an early-stage start-up. Please only apply if you're comfortable with this arrangement.
 





 Ready to code the future of gaming with us? Apply now and help shape something truly innovative.

title: Design Engineer (Remote)
description:
*This is a fully remote role, but you’ll need to be based in Europe.*
**What we’re building at Xata:**
 We're building a database platform for companies that rely on PostgreSQL at scale. And by “at scale,” we don’t just mean large volumes of data or high server counts, we also mean growing teams and the operational complexity that comes with them: staging and developer branches with data, data anonymization and privacy, zero-downtime schema changes, and more.
   

  

 In every feature we build, we optimise for developer experience, high performance, and flexibility. This gives our customers the confidence to rely on us for one of the most critical pieces of their cloud infrastructure.
   

  

 The AI wave of developer tools presents exciting opportunities and challenges - and PostgreSQL and Xata are well-positioned to be at the center of it. We’re a transparent company, maintaining several popular open-source projects, and we enjoy writing technical blog posts about how we solve various challenges.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
 You’ll be joining our Product team as a design engineer, working closely with the frontend engineering team. You’ll be responsible for the overall product UX, DX, and visual design. This includes defining design guidelines, creating shared styles and components, and ensuring consistency across the product and public website.
   

  

 At implementation time, you’ll contribute directly to the codebase or pair with frontend engineers. Our design process typically starts with simple wireframes and moves straight into coded prototypes (we usually skip high-fidelity mockups in Figma).
   

  

**We work with:**
* Next.js
* Shadcn
* Tailwind v4
* React flow
* Whimsical
* Figma
* v0


**In this role, you will:**
* Be an active contributor to our core product and public website.
* Collaborate in multifunctional project teams (with frontend engineers, marketing, and PMs) to create new features or improve existing ones - optionally leading such projects.


**About you:**
* You have a sharp eye for aesthetics.
* Experience with developer tools is a big plus.
* You’re a self-starter who takes responsibility.
* You’re comfortable working with design systems (preferably based on Shadcn and Tailwind).
* You have at least a basic knowledge of React.
* You’re open to leveraging AI tools like v0 to speed up development.
* You have strong CSS skills.
* You're comfortable working with Git and GitHub.


**Nice to haves:**
* Solid engineering skills - coding expertise is a big plus. Familiarity with APIs, HTML, CSS, JavaScript (React), and accessibility (A11y) is a bonus.
* Basic data visualisation skills (e.g. knowing what type of chart best represents data).
* Any experience with databases (MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB) - maybe you've built something with one.
* Experience working on open-source projects.
* Interest in the startup world - you’re a shipper!
* Basic illustration skills (we do everything in Figma - no Illustrator or complex vector tools).


**Working at Xata:**
* We’re stable. We’ve raised $35M and have years of runway.
* We're remote-first, with a team distributed around the world, mainly in Europe and on the East Coast of the USA.
* Be part of a healthy culture, one that genuinely supports innovation, empowers individuals, and cares deeply about its people.
* We work asynchronously. We don’t do agile. The team meets weekly to check in, and we use GitHub, Notion, and Slack to stay aligned.
* You'll have autonomy to lead features and projects and bring your ideas to the table.
* Our team is diverse.
* Xata is female-founded and the first developer platform with an all-female board of directors.
* We encourage conference meet-ups.


**What we offer all of our employees:**
* Competitive salary and stock options.
* Friendly, diverse, and inclusive work environment.
* 30 vacation days (not including local public holidays).
* 2 months of fully paid parental leave.
* Flexibility, autonomy, and real impact.
* Budget for home office setup + coworking space stipend.
* Continuous learning support - budget for conferences, courses, and books.
* Healthcare coverage.
* Two company offsites per year, with partners and kids welcome. So far, we’ve been to Italy, Greece, Spain, Portugal, and Iceland!
* Ample opportunity for career growth - there are no boundaries to your development at Xata.


**Our investors:**
 Xata is well-financed by amazing investors, including Guillermo Rauch (founder of Vercel), Shay Banon (co-founder and CEO of Elastic), Neha Narkhede (founder of Confluent), Elad Gil, Christian Bach, and Mathias Biilmann (founders of Netlify), and many others.
   

  

 We’ve raised a $30 million Series A from top investors (Index Ventures and Redpoint), having the first ever 100% female board for such a technical company.
   

  

**We care about diversity in tech:**
 If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply. We believe that our success is driven by the talented and diverse team we’ve brought together from a variety of backgrounds, cultures, and countries. We’re always challenging ourselves to build an inclusive culture that enables us to create innovative and successful products.
   

  

 Our founder, Monica Sarbu, also founded a non-profit organisation called Tupu, which helps tech companies support diversity in tech through mentorship.
   

  

 We're eager to hear from you, and if you decide to apply, we're rooting for you!
   

  

**How To Apply**
 If this role sounds like a fit, we’d love to hear from you! When applying, please include a link to your personal website or portfolio, along with your GitHub profile. Or, anywhere else we can see examples of your work that blend design and code.
   

  

 🌍 This is a fully remote role, but you’ll need to be based in Europe.🌍 This is a fully remote role, but you’ll need to be based in Europe.

title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer (Java) - ZEOS
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Over the last years, we learned that solving fulfillment-related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in Partner Program and Connected Retail joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional further fulfilment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 As a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at ZEOS, Zalando’s B2B Logistics unit developing Europe’s leading Logistics Platform recently launched under the ZEOS Logistics brand, you will be part of a team working on designing technical solutions to connect various e-commerce platforms seamlessly with the robust logistics ecosystem of ZEOS.
   

  

 You will ensure that all our operational processes like warehousing, inventory management, inventory distribution, deliveries and returns can be steered on various e-commerce platforms. You will have the chance to learn about the broad business background we’re working with. In line with the overall Zalando philosophy you bring visibility and transparency to processes and thus have a huge impact on our customers and key stakeholders.
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)**
* You work regularly with others to ensure the right software/engineering design approaches and methodologies are applied.
* Design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions that have a direct impact on our daily business with our partners.
* Discuss and design APIs and integrated solutions.
* Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well as operate large-scale applications on AWS.
* Working like a startup in an agile environment & taking ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation & maintenance. Write applications from scratch with the latest technologies free of your choice.
* Shape and champion an inclusive culture and diverse team environment.


**WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF**
* 10+ years of software engineering experience
* You have a deep understanding of microservice architecture, REST services and API design. Good knowledge of security concepts. Highly versed in deploying and operating applications in a cloud infrastructure.
* You are highly skilled as a Java Developer. Proven experience in frameworks like Spring Boot. Ideally you have experience with a distributed event store such as Apache Kafka.
* Experience with Frontend technologies like JavaScript (ES6 / ES2015), React, Typescript, Webpack, CSS/HTML, and showing interest in full stack development is a big Plus!
* You have a good understanding of PostgreSQL and cloud architectures/platforms (preferably AWS). Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use at Zalando.
* Demonstrated strong sense of ownership, entrepreneurial & analytical thinking add to your excellent communication skills.
* Ideally, you have experience integrating third-party services, such as through developing or working with middleware solutions.
* Shopify or other e-commerce experience is a merit.


**OUR OFFER**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

  

* 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
* Hybrid working model with 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
* Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
* 30 days of vacation a year
* Health and wellbeing options
* Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh\_src=22377bdd1us


*We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.*

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:
Note: "

 "

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
**Firmware Engineer – TinyML & Embedded AI** 




**TinyML | ARM Cortex-M | Edge AI | IoT Devices** 




  





 Join our partner as a
 **Firmware Engineer** 
 specializing in
 **TinyML** 
 to develop cutting-edge edge AI applications deployed in consumer electronics, industrial IoT, and smart sensing platforms.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Develop and optimize
 **TinyML models** 
 running on ARM Cortex-M and other low-power MCUs
* Implement efficient firmware pipelines integrating sensor data acquisition, pre-processing, and inference
* Collaborate with data scientists and hardware engineers to deploy ML algorithms on embedded platforms
* Work on power optimization techniques to extend battery life of edge devices
* Build test and validation frameworks for ML model performance and robustness
* Contribute to continuous integration and deployment pipelines for embedded AI solutions



  





**Core Skills** 



* Experience with embedded C/C++ development targeting ARM Cortex-M MCUs

* Experience with sensor interfacing (IMUs, microphones, cameras) and embedded signal processing
* Knowledge of real-time operating systems (FreeRTOS, Zephyr)

**Bonus Skills** 



* Experience with Python for ML model training and toolchain scripting
* Knowledge of wireless protocols (BLE, LoRa, WiFi)
* Familiarity with containerization and cloud tools for ML model lifecycle management
* Prior work on industrial IoT or consumer electronics products
* Contributions to open source TinyML projects or communities

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:

 As Senior Full Stack Developer, you will work with development and maintenance in one of our agile teams supporting the Business Support organization at If Skadeförsäkring. This means you will participate in Agile ceremonies, development initiatives, as well as monitoring and handling incidents in the products supported. Your work will involve:

* Is proactive and innovative

 Bergshamra, Stockholm

 October 1st or by agreement

**We look forward to your application!** 








**About Us**

*To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.*

title: Senior Mobile Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU WILL DO:**
 As a Senior Software Engineer - Mobile in the organization you will be in the center of the action where both design and product meet business. You will be working closely with Product Managers, Engineering Managers, all product teams, iOS and Android community. You should have a strong technical background, a passion for developing SDKs, mobile application development, and a drive to deliver bug-free developer and user experiences as per the business requirement without compromising on the industry best coding practices. We are looking for highly skilled and experienced for the role of Senior Software Engineer - Mobile to lead the development team of our internal tools. As an Mobile Developer, you will be responsible for designing and delivering robust and scalable solutions. You will also provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior members in the iOS and Android community.
   

  

**Team Description**
 The Experimentation and Visual Analytics team is dedicated to the creation of advanced internal tools designed for analyzing various test variations and interpreting data effectively. This team plays a pivotal role in collaborating with all product teams across H&M, ensuring that they develop and implement the most optimized solutions for launching new features. By leveraging data-driven insights, they aim to enhance the overall efficiency and effectiveness of feature releases, ultimately contributing to H&M’s commitment to innovation and excellence in customer experience.
   

  

**You will:**
* Lead the end-to-end development of complex native and multiplatform solutions, from concept to development including testing, distribution and writing documentation.
* Drive technical decision-making, provide architectural guidance, and ensure the implementation of best practices.
* Collaborate closely with iOS and Android community, cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and backend developers, to define requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Develop scalable and maintainable libraries, ensuring adherence to coding best practices, design patterns, and architectural guidelines.
* Provide technical guidance and mentor junior iOS and Android developers, reviewing their PRs and providing constructive feedback.
* Perform thorough code reviews to ensure code quality, performance, and adherence to established coding standards.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of UI components and iOS/Android applications through thorough testing, debugging, and optimization. Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues and performance bottlenecks.
* Collaborate with other teams to understand and guide developers.
* Define test plans and ensure comprehensive test coverage.
* Drive innovation by researching and implementing cutting-edge technologies.
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and advancements in mobile development, evaluate new tools and frameworks, and promote their adoption when appropriate. Also, share knowledge and best practices with the iOS and Android community.
* Participate in architectural discussions, providing insights and proposing solutions to enhance system architecture and overall product quality.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of development processes and workflows.
* Participate in Agile/Scrum development processes, contribute to sprint planning, and provide accurate estimations for project timelines.
* Collaborate with Security and Compliance teams to ensure that mobile solutions adhere to internal policies and industry regulations.
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines and automation strategies to improve development workflows and reduce manual efforts.


**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with..*
* 6+ years of experience in mobile development (Android and/or iOS).
* Hands-on experience with Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) for shared codebases
* Strong proficiency in Kotlin for Android and Multiplatform module development.
* Proficiency in Swift, Objective-C and Kotlin for iOS and Android application and SDK integration.
* Familiarity with Jetpack Compose and SwiftUI.
* Experience in building and publishing mobile SDKs/libraries for internal or external use.
* Deep understanding of platform-specific architecture and constraints (Android/iOS).
* Experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing in both platforms.
* Familiarity with KMP testing strategies including using expect/actual declarations.
* Comfortable with debugging native iOS and Android issues within shared and platform-specific code.
* Experience with modular architecture, clean code principles, and design patterns like MVVM.
* Strong understanding of dependency injection, coroutines/flows, and asynchronous programming.
* Ability to collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (iOS, Android, backend, product).
* Comfortable contributing to API design, versioning, and developer experience for SDKs.
* Familiarity with tools such as GitHub Actions for CI/CD in mobile projects.
* Experience working in Agile/Scrum team, actively participating in ceremonies and contributing to continuous delivery
* Proven experience in leading cross-platform mobile teams or initiatives, especially in contexts involving KMP or shared codebases. Experience with mobile analytics tools (e.g., Firebase or similar) and feature flagging/experimentation frameworks.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Software Engineer / Data Engineer
description:
*Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? Vi söker nu en teknisk rockstar som tycker att Linux är det självklara valet, är vass på Python och inte blir avskräckt av riktigt stora datamängder. Du är alltid hungrig på nya kunskaper och vill använda din dyrbara tid till att göra Sverige säkrare.*
 Ditt uppdrag
   

  

 I den här rollen är du både Data Engineer och systemutvecklare. Som Data Engineer designar, utvecklar och underhåller du lösningar som tolkar, bearbetar och lagrar stora mängder inhämtad data. Som systemutvecklare utvecklar du användarapplikationer som gör data tillgänglig för användning i verksamhetens underrättelseproduktion. Världen förändras och så även vårt data. Därför sker kontinuerlig utveckling i takt med att nya krav och behov uppstår.
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i ett team med helhetsansvar för sin informationsplattform. Teamet jobbar agilt med eget ansvar för utveckling och drift av hela stacken.
   

  

 Teamet har ett nära samarbete med andra delar inom produktionen av analys och bearbetningsförmågor. Både med slutanvändare och andra tekniska team som förser systemet med data.
   

  

 Vi strävar alltid efter att medarbetarna ska trivas och utvecklas. Vi ser det som en förutsättning för teamets effektivitet. Via utbildningar, konferenser och egen omvärldsbevakning håller vi oss uppdaterade på den senaste tekniken. Tillsammans utvärderar vi och tar del av varandras insikter.
   

  

 Du kan
   

  

**Du Har Följande Kompetens/erfarenhet**
* Högskoleutbildning inom datateknik, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande alternativt förvärvat motsvarande kompetens genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Bekväm i Linux
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Python
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift


 För Oss Är Det Viktigt Att Du Är Nyfiken, Ödmjuk, Har Ett Driv Att Lära Dig Nya Saker. Det Är Även Meriterande För Tjänsten Om Du Har Erfarenhet Från Ett Eller Flera Av Följande Områden
   

  

* Big Data / Stora datamängder
* NoSQL-databaser
* Relationsdatabaser
* Javascript
* Container / Kubernetes
* Informationsmodellering / Datamodellering
* Kommunikationsprotokoll IP/Telekom


 Du är
   

  

 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Därför tror vi att du till din natur är nyfiken på nya tekniker och håller dig uppdaterad om vad som händer, både vad gäller arbetsmetoder och nya produkter. Du gillar problemlösning och värdesätter att leverera slutprodukter av hög kvalitet. Du delar entusiastiskt med dig av dina kunskaper och lockas av möjligheten att vara med och påverka framtida teknikval och lösningar. Dessutom tycker du det är spännande och känner en stolthet i att få vara med och bygga utökad underrättelseförmåga för FRA.
   

  

 Om FRA
   

  

 FRA har omvärlden som sin arena där varje arbetsuppgift är en del av något större. På ett eller annat sätt får du som medarbetare vara med och bidra till att skydda Sveriges integritet och oberoende i världen. Du är med och gör skillnad på riktigt, varje dag.
   

  

 Vår uppgift som underrättelsetjänst är att skydda Sverige mot de allvarligaste hot som kan riktas mot ett samhälle – militära angrepp, terrorism och cyberattacker. Vi skyddar det viktigaste vi har – vår trygghet, vår demokrati och vårt sätt att leva. Vi är experter på cyberområdet och signalspaning samt en larmklocka för militära hot.
   

  

 FRA leder sedan 2024 Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter, NCSC vars uppdrag är att utveckla och stärka Sveriges förmåga att förebygga, upptäcka och hantera cyberhot.
   

  

 Som nyanställd på FRA får du en omfattande introduktionsutbildning och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, vilket ger dig möjlighet att utveckla dina färdigheter och bli ännu bättre på det du brinner för. Vår organisation är mångfacetterad och består av olika kompetenser och personligheter, där varje individ har unika egenskaper och förutsättningar. Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla känner sig välkomna och trygga. Utöver en stimulerande arbetsmiljö erbjuder vi också ett attraktivt förmånspaket, som du kan läsa mer om på www.fra.se . För mer information om Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter besök www.ncsc.se
   

  

 För din trygghet. För vår demokrati. Varje dag. Året om.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

 Arbetsplatsen är belägen i närheten av Drottningholm, ca 10 min från Brommaplan. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef på nummer
 **010-557 49 53** 
 . Fackliga företrädare nås på 010-557 46 00.
   

  

 Vi tar emot ansökningar via www.fra.se
 **senast 2025-08-31**
 Referensnummer
 **2024FRA1025-5** 
 .
   

  

 Då vi inför denna rekrytering redan tagit ställning till de rekryteringskanaler vi önskar använda undanber vi oss att bli kontaktade för ytterligare erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.
   

  

**Sökord** 
 :
 *Python, Linux, Big Data, Engineer*

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - Mortgage Product
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
 Now we need you, your ambition, and your expertise to join us as we continue to grow our product offering within Mortgage. You will be joining a small entrepreneurial team working closely within the dynamics of the larger organisation to provide a top-class mortgage comparison service to our customers.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a skilled and well-rounded senior developer who enjoys being engaged in the product development process and actively participating in discovery and prioritization, with an ability to balance delivery speed versus technical necessities. Your focus will be on designing, developing, and maintaining mission-critical backend services, while also contributing to the frontend to ensure seamless customer experiences.
   

  

 You will be working closely with your product manager, designers, and fellow developers to take full ownership of the product lifecycle. We expect you not to shy away from interacting with the full team and asking extensive questions as part of the continuous delivery process.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate in an empowered product team to shape technical solutions that solve real customer problems.
* Participate in all phases of the product development lifecycle, from concept to deployment.
* Design, build, and maintain scalable and secure backend services, including APIs, data models, and infrastructure, that drive customer-facing applications with a focus on performance, reliability, and maintainability.
* Analyse usage data and system performance to inform architectural and product decisions.
* Contribute to frontend development when needed, ensuring a cohesive experience across the stack.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.


**Qualifications**
* Proven track record as a developer with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, preferably with full-stack responsibility and high shipping frequency.
* Relevant Computer Science or Engineering Education (at least at BA level) or equivalent experience from work.
* Solid understanding of software development principles and methodologies.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Bonus if you have experience working with data science, analytics, or machine learning workflows—whether through building data pipelines, supporting experimentation, or integrating predictive models into production systems.


 We value experience or familiarity with our chosen technologies, such as Node.js, React, Docker, AWS, but for the right candidate who has shown curiosity in different technologies and architectures, we will provide the necessary learning environment to quickly get up to speed with our stack and ways of working.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 400 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in all markets.

title: Engineering Manager
company_industry: Entertainment Providers, E-Learning Providers, and Consumer Services
description:
We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit… well, forced. But we’d like to think that our story is special for real.
 



  





 Our founders, Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, came to Sweden from Syria when they were kids. Books became their compass, guiding them through the maze of life, and helping them shape their destinies in a new world.
 



  





 Their dream was bold: What if they could unlock the world of books for everyone, making knowledge and inspiration accessible to all? Fast forward a few years, and the tale of Nextory was born.
 



  





 At Nextory, we've crafted a revolutionary monthly subscription that empowers our users to devour books like never before, be it through reading or listening. It's not just a product; it's a passport to endless adventure and enlightenment.
 



  





 And now, we're on a quest to find our next
 **Engineering Manager** 
 , someone as passionate as we are about making the world a happier place and enriching lives through the world of reading. Join our extraordinary team, and let's script a future where every day is a chapter of discovery, and every book is a key to a richer life.
 



  





**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING** 




 As the
 **Engineering Manager** 
 – Discovery at Nextory you will lead the work of developing the most vital parts of the user experience: to serve all our users content they will love at the right time, and in a delightful way.
 



  





 You will be leading an amazing team of software engineers; iOS, Android and Java backend – always with the continuous aspiration to increase reading! You will collaborate closely with product- and engineering leaders across the company to understand the needs of the users and figure out the best way to solve them.
 



  





 The position is based in Stockholm and you will report to the CTO.
 



  





**WHO YOU ARE** 




 We believe that you are currently working in a similar role at a fast-moving company. We believe that you would like to be in the forefront of creating delightful mobile applications, and you believe that using AI as an enabler for that . We believe that you take pride in our product, that you love to drive development, that you are always striving to improve and that you believe that quality is key. You thrive working in a dynamic and unpretentious environment where you take great responsibility for our product and your team!
 



  





**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS** 



* We believe you have, for the field, relevant educational background



  




* We believe you have around 10+ years of working experience, and around 5 years from working as a manager



  




* We believe that you have hands-on experience from working with as a software developer



  




* We believe you have experience using AI-assisted coding and coaching teams to adopt that workflow



  




* We believe you have experience from cloud infrastructure (GCP, AWS, or Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)



  




* We believe you have solid understanding of DevOps practices such as CI/CD, observability, and that is your preferred way of working



  




* We believe you have experience from both relational and NoSQL databases



  




* We believe that you have experience from working with distributed teams and that it is part of your daily work to drive change and strive for improvement



  




* Experience in streaming services is a plus



  





 We are looking forward to your application which should include a CV or LinkedIn profile. Also, we would love a pitch of why you are the leader we are looking for!
 



  





**WORK ENVIRONMENT AND IMPORTANT DETAILS** 




 At Nextory, we believe a strong and inclusive culture is key to our success - and that culture flourishes when we meet and collaborate in person as much as possible. That’s why we spend the majority of the working time at our beautiful office!
 



  





 We are based in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in Paris and Bangalore. Our hybrid work policy includes four days in the office and Wednesdays as a work-from-home day.
 



  





 Please note that we do not offer relocation and that a six-month probationary period applies.
 



 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct a background check on the final candidate.

title: Intelligent Automation Lead
description:
Are you passionate about driving digital transformation and building intelligent automation solutions that make a real impact? At Seco, we’re looking for an Intelligent Automation Lead to join us and influence how we work with AI and automation. You’ll be at the forefront of this exciting journey—helping shape strategy, build scalable solutions, and empower teams across the organization.
   

  

**About The Job**
 In this position, you're responsible for leading the operational use of Microsoft Power Platform—including Power Apps, Power Automate, and Copilot Studio— as well as no-code/low-code and RPA technologies to drive process automation and digital transformation. You act as a technical business analyst and an active developer, bridging business and IT, and identifying high-value automation opportunities.
   

  

 You also:
   

  

* Serve as a hands-on enabler and subject matter expert in low-code/no-code and automation development.
* Guide business units in adopting intelligent and agentic automation tools.
* Take an active role in designing, developing, and deploying solutions using Power Platform and RPA tools like UiPath.
* Establish governance, best practices, and security standards for scalable automation.
* Create training materials and reusable components to support citizen developers.
* Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to ensure seamless integration.
* Has a genuine interest in Artificial Intelligence technologies and wants to develop and grow within the area and at the same time keep Seco at the forefront of innovation.


 The location for this position is Stockholm, Sweden or Pune, India and we apply a hybrid work solution.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for someone with proven experience in data, automation, or digital transformation roles, with a focus on low-code/no-code platforms. You bring deep expertise in Microsoft Power Platform, including solution design, governance, and lifecycle management, as well as a strong foundation in data governance, integration, and process modeling. Familiarity with agentic automation tools like Microsoft Copilot Studio and experience with Agile, DevOps, and product-driven environments is a plus. Relevant certifications in Power Platform or Microsoft 365 are advantageous. Acting in a global environment calls for proficiency in English, verbally and in writing.
   

  

 You combine technical excellence with a collaborative and customer-focused approach. By communicating clearly and confidently with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, you translate business needs into scalable solutions. You’re structured and analytical, yet flexible and curious—ready to adapt to new tools and technologies. You thrive in dynamic environments where your ideas can shape the future.
   

  

**Our Seco culture** 
  

  

 Seco employees across the globe share our family spirit, along with a passion for our customers and a personal commitment to ensure success in everything we do. For us, it’s also clear that our diversities form an amazing foundation for achieving great results. Curious about our workplace and benefits? Read more on our website. You’re also welcome to visit our LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us and our products further.
   

  

**Contact information** 
  

  

 For further information about this position, please contact Joel Strandh, hiring manager, joel.strandh@secotools.com
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

* David Romlin, Unionen, +46 (0)70-608 46 90
* Suncana Bandalo, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-300 10 73
* Benny Christiansen, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-523 50 60


 Recruitment Specialist: Gustaf Sjögren
   

  

 At Seco, we value a healthy work-life balance and will be away on summer vacation. Therefore, it can be difficult to reach us, and the recruitment process might take longer than usual.
   

  

  

  

**How To Apply**
 Send us your application no later than August 10, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0079928.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 For more information about our recruitment process, please contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*At Seco we develop and offer advanced products & solutions that make metal cutting easier. We work together with our customers to identify and implement the best solutions for their needs. The corporate culture empowers employees through shared values: Passion for our customers, Family Spirit, Personal commitment. Seco Tools has a presence in more than 75 countries and employs about 4000 people.*

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga en modern DevOps-miljö för framtidens bank- och försäkringslösningar? Vi söker en senior DevOps Engineer som vill vara drivande i att utveckla vår leveransplattform och våra molnlösningar – i en organisation där teknik, kultur och kundvärde går hand i hand.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Rollen som DevOps Engineer är central i vår produktutveckling där fokus ligger på att effektivisera, automatisera och skala upp vår tekniska leveransförmåga. Du kommer att arbeta på en plattform där utvecklingsteam snabbt och säkert kan bygga, testa, deploya och övervaka applikationer genom välstrukturerade pipelines och self-service-lösningar.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Etablera och vidareutveckla vår Internal Developer Platform (IDP)
* Automatisera hela utvecklingsflödet genom CI/CD-pipelines, releasehantering och deployment-strategier
* Samarbeta med produktteam, säkerhet, drift och arkitekter för att driva DevOps-praxis i hela utvecklingskedjan
* Designa och implementera robusta DevOps-lösningar i Azure Cloud (primär plattform) – AWS är meriterande
* Integrera säkerhet och regelefterlevnad-förmågor i leveranskedjan (Shift Left & DevSecOps)
* Bidra till vision, strategi och roadmap för vår gemensamma utvecklingsplattform
* Delta i tekniska communitys och kunskapsdelning över team och ARTs


 Du arbetar agilt i en organisation som tillämpar SAFe i stor skala, och du blir en viktig del i att bygga en skalbar, resilient och produktiv DevOps-miljö.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är en tekniskt stark och nyfiken och brinner för automation, struktur och utvecklarupplevelse. Du har ett holistiskt tänk kring plattform och värdeskapande utveckling, och du trivs i en roll där du får kombinera teknik med samarbete, strategi och förbättringsarbete. Du är en doer med struktur och integritet – och en naturlig lagspelare i agila team.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Minst 10 års erfarenhet inom DevOps, systemutveckling eller plattformsutveckling
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Azure Cloud, containerplattformar som OpenShift/Kubernetes/Docker
* Djup förståelse för CI/CD-principer, infrastrukturautomatisering och pipelineförmågor
* Erfarenhet av att bygga eller arbeta med Internal Developer Platforms (IDP)
* Förmåga att skapa self-service-funktionalitet och stödja developer experience
* Kunskap inom Infrastructure as Code (IaC) med t.ex. Terraform, ARM/Bicep eller liknande
* Förståelse för säkerhetsaspekter i DevOps (t.ex. hemlighetshantering, SAST/DAST, policy enforcement)
* Erfarenhet av arbete i agila ramverk, gärna SAFe
* Hög teknisk kommunikationsförmåga – du kan både förenkla och fördjupa beroende på målgrupp
* Grundläggande förståelse för svenska och engelska i tal och skrift och en ambition att ständigt utvecklas


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av AWS och hybrid cloud-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av observability-verktyg och metricsbaserad utveckling
* Kunskap inom GitOps, eventdriven arkitektur och serverless
* Erfarenhet från plattformsdriven utveckling i större organisationer


**Om oss**
 Process and Dev Tools är en del av Digital Solution & Operation Platform, DSOP inom vår IT-organisation Digital & IT. Vi erbjuder stöd, förmågor, verktyg, tekniska plattformar samt processer för samtliga utvecklingsteam inom Länsförsäkringar. Vi arbetar enligt SAFe, med en tydlig vision att skapa en hållbar och effektiv produktutveckling – där DevOps är en självklar grundförutsättning.
   

  

 Teamet består idag av Produkt Owners, DevOps Engineers, Scrum Masters och Process Owner som tillsammans ansvarar för våra förmågor och processer för IT-utveckling. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande laganda med högt i tak kultur och stora möjligheter till utveckling.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-01**

title: Lead Python Software Engineer, Commercial Systems
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems for global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in more than 80 countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Lead Python Software Engineer** 
 who strives for the highest engineering quality, seeks improvements, continuously develops their skills, and applies them at work. This is an exciting opportunity to work with many popular software systems, integrations technologies, and exciting open source solutions.
   

  

 The Commercial Systems unit is conceived as seven engineering teams that closely collaborate with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. Services designed, developed, and operated by the Commercial Systems unit are at the heart of Canonical business and Python plays an integral role in it. We are looking for Python Software Engineers for the Integrations team.
   

  

 The
 **Integrations** 
 team is responsible for the automation of SAAS user management and onboarding of new data sources to the data mesh. The team designs, develops, and operates a Python based solution to automate SAAS seat management and track spend across the application portfolio. Furthermore the team integrates internal and external data sources into the data mesh using open-source ETL solutions, enabling more data driven decisions in the organization.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Develop engineering solutions leveraging Python
* Collaborate with colleagues on technical designs and code reviews
* Deploy and operate services developed by the team
* Depending on your seniority, coach, mentor, and offer career development feedback
* Develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
* Experience with software development in Python
* Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


**Nice-to-have skills**
* Performance engineering and security experience
* Experience with Airbyte, Ranger, Temporal, or Trino


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
