* Har du vana att arbeta i agila miljöer med DevOps/Scrum/SAFe-ramverk eller liknande?


 JA/NEJ – beskriv din erfarenhet.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och svar på urvalsfrågor via e-post till jobb.na@polisen.se
 **senast den 15/8 2025.** 
 Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen.
 **Märk din ansökan med referensnummer A440.509/2025 i mailets ärendemening.**
 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning under https://polisen.se/krigsplacering och https://polisen.se/sakerhetsprovning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering

title: Network Security Manager
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you interested to embark on a new career journey where you can make a real impact? I'm
 **Viktor Wåhlberg, Head of CTO Office** 
 , and I'm looking for a
 **Network Security Manager** 
 to join my team.
   

  

 This position is ideal for a highly motivated, tech-savvy, hands-on professional who is committed to making a significant impact.
   

  

**As a** 
**Network Security Manager, you’ll…**
* Lead cross-functional security initiatives within the Networks organization, with a strong focus on advancing and reinforcing the overall security agenda.
* Collaborate across countries and group functions to ensure that Network-related initiatives are aligned with security requirements and best practices.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for all security-related matters within the Networks domain, including support for sourcing and procurement activities.
* Stay updated of industry trends and emerging best practices, contributing actively to the continuous improvement and strategic development of the security function at Telia.


**Who We Are Looking For**
 Someone focused on creating value who possesses strong problem-solving, communication and technical skills, alongside a growth mindset. You should also have:
   

  

* Experience focused on security within a Nordic business context (+5 years), preferably with exposure to TMT industry.
* Knowledge of Network domain (such as 5G networks, network cloud, IP or similar) and extensive experience working within complex technological environments.
* Exposure to best practices, industry standards and frameworks such as ITIL, ISO 27001, NIST CSF.
* Proficiency in English language (both written and spoken form).
* A master’s degree in engineering or a related field.


**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We are looking forward to your application by
 **2024-09-05** 
 . If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen - together**

title: Affärsdriven BIM-strateg
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Architecture and Planning, and Environmental Services
description:
**BIM-strateg till Sweco – där teknik möter affär**
 Vill du kombinera tekniskt ledarskap med affärsutveckling i en central roll inom digital samhällsbyggnad? Som BIM-strateg hos oss på Sweco får du en nyckelroll i att driva innovation, kvalitet och digital utveckling i några av branschens mest spännande uppdrag.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har lång erfarenhet inom BIM och informationssamordning och som vill vara med och forma framtidens hållbara samhällen – både tekniskt och affärsmässigt.
   

  

**Din framtida roll**
 Som BIM-strateg hos Sweco kommer du att ha en central roll i våra uppdrag – där teknik, affär och digital utveckling möts. Du ansvarar för att utveckla och implementera digitala strategier och arbetsflöden som bidrar till en effektiv, kvalitativ och hållbar projektering.
   

  

 Du leder och stöttar BIM-samordnare och projektörer i både dagligt arbete och långsiktig kompetensutveckling. Med din erfarenhet fungerar du som mentor för teamet – någon som inspirerar, utmanar och vägleder i pågående uppdrag.
   

  

 Du har ett helhetsansvar för projektens BIM-relaterade aktiviteter att utveckla smarta arbetssätt, säkra informationsflöden och samordna digitala processer mellan alla parter. Du stödjer även projektledare i strategiska frågor kopplade till innovation, automation och digitalisering.
   

  

 Eftersom våra kunder har olika mognadsnivå inom BIM ges du möjlighet att anpassa arbetssätt och lösningar för att skapa maximalt kundvärde. Det innebär att du kommer nära affären – vi ser gärna att du trivs i dialog med kund, och att du drivs av att bygga relationer, skapa samarbeten och hitta nya affärsmöjligheter.
   

  

 Du blir en nyckelperson i vår fortsatta utvecklingsresa – både i projekt och i vår egen organisation – där du bidrar till att lyfta vår samlade digitala förmåga, affärsmässighet och interna effektivitet.
   

  

**Är du den vi letar efter?**
 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en strukturerad, självgående och kommunikativ ledare med gedigen erfarenhet inom BIM och digitalisering av byggprocesser. Du har lätt för att samarbeta med både interna och externa intressenter, och du motiveras av att driva utveckling och strategiskt arbete inom projektmiljöer.
   

  

 Du har vana av att arbeta med flera av marknadens ledande BIM-verktyg och system, och besitter en djup förståelse för de processer och arbetsflöden som krävs för att effektivt implementera digitala strategier. Vi ser att du har ett naturligt engagemang i att utveckla och förbättra arbetsmetoder, och att du är en person som inspirerar och stöttar dina kollegors kompetensutveckling.
   

  

**Krav för rollen**
* Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning om minst 3 år.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete med BIM i komplexa projekt.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta affärsnära – du är affärsmässig, trivs i kunddialoger och drivs av att skapa nya samarbeten.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i projekteringsverktyg och digitala processer.
* Erfarenhet av att leda och koordinera, samt att driva förändrings- och förbättringsarbete inom projekt.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


**Om teamet och hur det är att arbeta hos oss**
 Vi är ett engagerat och kompetent team på 25 medarbetare som arbetar med informationssamordning, datasamordning och BIM-samordning – främst i projekt kopplade till infrastruktur. Vår grupp präglas av en öppen och inkluderande kultur där vi delar kunskap, stöttar varandra och har nära till både skratt och fördjupade samtal – både internt och i våra projekt.
   

  

 Vi är involverade i många typer av uppdrag – från mindre specialistinsatser till stora multidisciplinära infrastrukturprojekt. Exempel på tjänster vi levererar är
   

  

* BIM-samordning och digital projektsamordning
* Informations- och datasamordning i CDE-miljöer (t.ex. ProjectWise, Trimble Connect, Autodesk Construction Cloud)
* Framtagande av digitala leveransstrategier och informationsstrukturer
* Modellgranskning, kollisionskontroller och kravhantering
* Implementering av automationslösningar och scriptutveckling
* Koordinering av geodata, punktmoln och 3D-underlag i infrastrukturprojekt


 Vårt mål är att din tid på Sweco ska bli den bästa i ditt arbetsliv. Med våra olika kompetenser och perspektiv bidrar vi gemensamt till att lösa våra kunders utmaningar och utveckla framtidens hållbara samhälle. Hos oss får du förutsättningar att nå din fulla potential – och möjlighet att göra verklig skillnad.
   

  

 Vårt ledarskap bygger på en balans mellan att utmana och att ge stöd. Du har en kontinuerlig dialog med din närmaste chef om din utveckling och ditt välmående, och vi arbetar aktivt för att skapa en trygg och tydlig arbetsmiljö där du får växa, ta ansvar och lyckas – både individuellt och i team.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Är du intresserad av rollen?
   

  

 Då är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag.
   

  

 Annonsen kommer att vara publicerad till den 12/9.
 *Vi kommer börja gå igenom ansökningarna i slutet av augusti.* 
 Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Har du ytterligare frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten är du mer än välkommen att kontakta oss!
   

  

 Aneta Kopec, Gruppchef
   

  

 073 364 31 67
   

  

 aneta.kopec@sweco.se
   

  

 På Sweco vill vi vara en arbetsplats präglad av mångfald. Vi tror att fler perspektiv breddar vår förmåga att fortsätta nå våra mål och eftersträvar mångfald i våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

 Sweco planerar och utformar morgondagens hållbara samhällen och städer. Med den samlade kunskapen hos våra 22 000 arkitekter, ingenjörer och andra experter arbetar vi tillsammans med våra kunder för att möjliggöra den gröna omställningen, maximera digitaliseringens potential och stärka samhällets motståndskraft. Sweco är Europas ledande konsultföretag inom arkitektur och teknik med en omsättning på cirka 31 miljarder SEK under 2024. Företaget är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm. www.swecogroup.com.

title: Warranty Project Engineer
emails: jonas.lindberg@siemens-energy.com, narcissa.tellefsen@siemens-energy.com, unionen.finspang.se@siemens-energy.com, asi.se@siemens-energy.com, anders.fors@siemens-energy.com, mikael.malmgren@siemens-energy.com
description:
**A Snapshot of Your Day**


Join a role where your expertise in gas turbines is not just appreciated but celebrated. As a Warranty Project Engineer, you’ll collaborate closely with the warranty project leader and logistic planner, playing a pivotal role in our Technical Support team. Your day will be filled with dynamic problem-solving, providing top-notch global support, and adapting to the ever-changing demands of our turbines and customers. Located in our Finspång office, you’ll be at the heart of innovative projects, making a significant impact on global customer satisfaction.

 **How You’ll Make an Impact**

* Support and advise the warranty project leader with your technical expertise, ensuring the success and efficiency of crucial projects.
* Coordinate and lead technical investigations to resolution and implementation on site, collaborating seamlessly with relevant departments and personnel.
* Understand customer requirements, implement them effectively, and guarantee customer satisfaction, thereby directly contributing to the company’s reputation and excellence.

**What You Bring**

* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, or related), or equivalent experience.
* Extensive expertise in gas turbines, particularly Siemens Energy MGT fleet like SGT600/700/750 and 800.
* Proficiency in IT systems and software, especially SAP, PLM2020, and Microsoft Office.
* Excellent communication skills in English; knowledge of Swedish is an advantage.
* Ability to coordinate technical issues, conduct meetings, and present technical scopes to customers.

**About the Team**


Join a dynamic team within the ICW department, comprising Sub-Project Managers, Site Engineers, Warranty Project Managers, Technical Analysts, and Warranty Project Engineers. Our mission is to provide exceptional technical support and ensure customer satisfaction across the globe. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and a shared commitment to excellence. I NEED MORE INFO FOR THIS.

**Who is Siemens Energy?**


At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. With +100,000 dedicated employees in more than 90 countries, we develop the energy systems of the future, ensuring that the growing energy demand of the global community is met reliably and sustainably. The technologies created in our research departments and factories drive the energy transition and provide the base for one sixth of the world’s electricity generation.  

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.  

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

**Our Commitment to Diversity**


Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion, and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character—no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

 **Application**


Don’t hesitate – apply via https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/en\_US/jobs , id nr 278503 not later than 2025-09-04.

  

Ongoing selection is applied, the role might be filled before last application date.


For questions about the role, please contact the recruiting manager Jonas Lindberg on jonas.lindberg@siemens-energy.com


For questions about the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter Narcissa Gvozdar Tellefsen on narcissa.tellefsen@siemens-energy.com


We refrain from all contact with staffing and recruitment companies, or advertising brokers.

  

Location: Finspång

 **Trade Union Representatives:**  

Unionen, unionen.finspang.se@siemens-energy.com  

Sveriges Ingenjörer & SACO, asi.se@siemens-energy.com  

Ledarna, Anders Fors, anders.fors@siemens-energy.com  

IF Metall, Mikael Malmgren, mikael.malmgren@siemens-energy.com

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
description:
About us
  
At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
  
  

You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $35M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
  
The role
  
As a Senior Fullstack Engineer at Legora you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
  
  

**What you will be doing:**  

Architect and implement features end-to-end for our web platform
  
Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
  
Work with technologies such as Python, React, Node.js, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
  
Review code and mentor junior colleagues to support them in their development, making the team even better!
  
Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself
  
  

Who you are
  
A passionate engineer with a several years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
  
You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
  
You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
  
You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
  
Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus
  
  

What's in it for you
  
Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
  
Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
  
A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
  
Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
  
Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.

title: Equipment Engineer (all genders)
description:
**Munters is a key contributor and esteemed collaborator in the realm of energy-efficient air treatment solutions. Using innovative technologies, the company’s expert engineers create the climate for customers in a wide range of industries, the largest food, pharmaceutical and data center sectors. Munters has been defining the future of air treatment since 1955. Today, manufacturing and sales are carried out in 30 countries by around 3,900 employees. Munters reports annual net sales of approx. 950M EUR and is listed on the Stockholm stock exchange; Nasdaq Stockholm (Large Cap).**

**Job Purpose**


The Equipment Engineer plays a key role in enhancing manufacturing within the organization by developing and implementing innovative equipment strategies, technologies, and principles that improve operational efficiency, productivity, and scalability across production sites.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead the development and deployment of next-generation manufacturing equipment and automation solutions aligned with strategic business goals.
* Define and implement future manufacturing principles, focusing on lean, digitization, modularization, and scalability.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Production, R&D, Quality, IT, and Global Engineering) to translate operational needs into technical equipment solutions.
* Evaluate, design, and optimize equipment concepts and layouts to ensure efficiency, reliability, and flexibility in production environments.
* Identify and drive continuous improvement opportunities in equipment design and integration to enhance throughput, reduce waste, and lower total cost of ownership (TCO).
* Act as technical lead in capital investment projects related to production equipment and automation.
* Benchmark industry trends and emerging technologies to propose strategic equipment development road maps.
* Develop and maintain equipment technical specifications, standards, and documentation.
* Support pilot implementations, testing, and validation of new equipment technologies before full-scale deployment.
* Ensure compliance with applicable safety, environmental, and quality standards in equipment design and operations

**Required Qualifications & Skills**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Automation Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related technical field.
* 5+ years of experience in equipment engineering, manufacturing engineering, or related roles within an industrial or high-tech manufacturing environment.
* Evidence of improving operational efficiency by employing equipment innovation or applying strategic manufacturing principles.
* Extensive knowledge of lean manufacturing, automation technologies, and enhancing production processes.
* Experience with CAD tools, simulation software, and equipment specification development.
* Advanced project management and stakeholder coordination capabilities.
* Proficient problem-solving capabilities and strategic mindset.
* Effective communicator in cross-functional and multicultural environments.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience in chemistry and process automation, packaging or similar discrete manufacturing industries.
* Knowledge of Industry 4.0 concepts and digital factory initiatives.
* Familiarity with equipment life cycle management and total productive maintenance (TPM) practices.

**Why Join Us?**


Be part of an innovative team working to improve the landscape of manufacturing. Work in a dynamic global environment with a focus on innovation and sustainability. Opportunity to shape strategic investments in smart equipment and digital production solutions.
company_description: Munters is a global leader in climate control solutions for mission-critical processes.

title: Instrument Scientist at Balder Beamline
description:
Lund University was founded in 1666 and is repeatedly ranked among the world’s top universities. The University has around 47 000 students and more than 8 800 staff based in Lund, Helsingborg and Malmö. We are united in our efforts to understand, explain and improve our world and the human condition. Lund University welcomes applicants with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We regard gender equality and diversity as a strength and an asset.

**Your team**
  

The Balder beamline is dedicated to X-ray absorption spectroscopy (XAS) and X-ray emission spectroscopy (XES) experiments in the medium and hard X-ray energy range, 2.4 - 40 keV. The beamline is in user operation since 2019 and serves users from a magnitude of fields within material science, catalysis, chemistry, physics, biology, geology and environmental science. The beamline is specialized towards work with in-situ/operando X-ray spectroscopy and to handle dilute and sensitive samples, often in a multimodal fashion combined with XRD or XRF. The high brilliance from the 3 GeV storage ring in combination with the beamline design allows us to perform time-resolved measurements down to sub-second time resolution. To achieve this, Balder uses bespoke X-ray optics and complex scientific hardware, X-ray detectors and sample environments. The nature of the samples is also highly varied from gases to solid samples, and may require use of tailored reactor cells or cryogenic temperatures, for example. An advanced gas mixing system is presently installed to serve user experiments. All of this require Balder to achieve high levels of reliability to enable users to carry out experiments 24/7.  

  

**Would you like to work at one of the brightest lightsources in the world?**  

  

**MAX IV is looking for an** instrument scientist (research engineer) who will have the overarching view of the beamline instruments as well as coordinate and execute beamline operation, commissioning, maintenance and further development of Balder beamline together with the Balder team.  

  

**Your main work tasks will be**

* To maintain and develop the beamline instruments to keep the beamline operational and state of the art
* To actively participate in development of beamline software
* To work actively with user support as local contact, from pre-planning to execute beamtime experiments and data analysis support for Balder techniques, mainly X-ray Absorption Spectroscopy (including EXAFS). On call duties will apply
* Together with the beamline team deliver first class user science

**To be successful in this role you need to have the following qualifications**

* PhD in physics, chemistry, engineering or closely related discipline
* Extensive experience of work at or use of hard X-ray Absorption Spectroscopy beamline
* Expertise in XAS analysis (XANES and EXAFS)

**Below are seen as merits**

* Experience with user support and instrumentation at hard X-ray spectroscopy beamline
* Leading instrument development projects
* Combined XAS and X-ray diffraction, including XRD analysis
* Python programming for data reduction, gui and analysis pipelines
* Basic knowledge of Tango based control systems
* Practical experience of XES data collection and analysis

**As a person you are** a proactive team player with excellent problem solving and communication skills, fluency in English, and have the ability to effectively manage your time and priorities in an international environment.

 **What we offer**  

When you join our MAX IV team, you step into a world of front edge science. We make the invisible visible by supporting scientist from all over the world, generating scientific results for the benefit of society. We offer you a multicultural work environment with great opportunities for personal development with respect for a healthy work-life balance.


Would you like to work in a challenging and supporting environment? Then join us and take the opportunity to make a real difference!

 **For further information, please visit:**
  

https://www.lunduniversity.lu.se/about-lund-university/work-lund-university
  

www.sweden.se
  

https://www.maxiv.lu.se/about-us/careers/compensation-benefits/


Probationary period may apply.

  

MAX IV is a Swedish national large-scale research infrastructure hosted by Lund University. It provides scientists from Sweden and abroad, with intense x-rays and state-of-the-art instrumentation for research in areas such as engineering, physics, structural biology, chemistry and nanotechnology. Its 16 beamlines receive up to 2 000 scientists annually, conducting ground-breaking experiments in materials and life sciences using the brilliant X-rays.


We kindly decline all sales and marketing contacts.

title: QA Engineer for Team AC-OP
description:
**About Etraveli Group**


Etraveli Group is the globally leading company for tech solutions and fulfillment capabilities for online sales of flights. We are here to solve complexity, by connecting millions of flights and travelers across the globe, from search and selection to trip and beyond. We hold consumer online travel agency brands like Mytrip, GoToGate & Flight Network and serve exclusively Booking.com with flights. Etraveli Group has also established strategic partnerships with companies like Skyscanner, Google Flights and TUI.


Every day we strive to make the world smaller for our customers and bigger for our people. Our diverse team of more than 3000 passionate professionals is what makes us the industry’s tech wonder and the best in the world at what we do. Our major offices are in Sweden (HQ), Greece, India, Canada, Poland and Uruguay.


Are you ready to be a **cornerstone of innovation** in a company experiencing rapid global expansion? We're now seeking a **highly motivated Senior QA Engineer** for one of our development teams.

**The Team**


ACOP (Air Content – Order Process) is the team at the heart of our booking flow where most of our orders pass through. In is a tight-knit group of 7 developers (and growing), working on high-impact features and maintaining the most critical part of our platform.


You’ll be joining a team full of senior engineers, so whether you’re eager to dive into the air travel domain, strengthen your product thinking, or level up your software engineering skills, this is a great place to do it.

**Tester at Etraveli Technology**


At Etraveli Technology you will work with test activities such as exploratory testing and construct automated test to support your team, and the company as a whole. You will be a part of the process from start to finish working shift left and right with the activities that are best suited depending on the context.

* Develop and maintain existing automation framework.
* Help set up, monitor the environment and keep track of the release pipeline, failed automatic test and either fix them or escalate them.
* Analyze business needs, implementation documentation, design specifications for validity, testability and feasibility.
* Contribute with new ideas within the QA chapter/guild together with other testers.
* Apply quality engineering principles throughout the whole Agile product lifecycle.
* Help out with process improvement to increase work efficiency and quality delivered.
* Act as a domain expert that holds together the customer journey throughout the whole system.
* Use tools such as TestCafe, Postman, Selenium, Kibana, Jira.

**Requirements**

* +3 years work experience within software testing
* Previous experience working with test automation
* Good knowledge in Java and/or JavaScript

**Benefits**


When working at Etraveli Group you will always feel that you are trusted and that you can rely on others to help you. To work together as a team and feel that you are challenged in a way that helps you evolve within your profession. You will have awesome colleagues together with whom you will solve complex problems in a fast-moving business. But not just that.


What else do we offer?

* Brand new office in the City – We are located in Merkurhuset, Skeppsbron, in central Gothenburg, just a stone's throw away from public transport and lunch restaurants.
* Conferences – We believe in personal development and continuous education. We continuously organize internal trainings and workshops so that we can learn from each other.
* Healthcare allowance – Each employee receives a maximum allowable amount each year according to the Swedish Tax Agency to spend on health-promoting activities such as a gym card, massage etc.
* Pension and health insurance – Through partners we offer a comprehensive pension and health insurance so that you can get help quickly in case of an accident.
* Hackaton and Dev week – We believe in fostering creativity and testing new things. Therefore, we have recurring Hackaton and Dev weeks where the teams decide what they want to work on.
* To kick the day off just right, we serve breakfast at the office every morning.

**As part of this recruitment process, we will be conducting background checks. You will be able to read more information and give your consent to this process in the application form.**

*At Etraveli Group we value diversity; we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds.* *During hiring, we are committed to ensure equality and promote diversity in the workplace at every selection stage. As such, we provide the same opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, religion or belief, gender, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic protected under any anti-discrimination law or regulation.*

title: Senior CAE Engineer
description:
We are seeking an experienced CAE Engineer to join our Engineering team in Jönköping, Sweden. The ideal candidate will have extensive knowledge in simulation, combined with design experience. You will work globally in cross-functional project teams to develop, analyze, and optimize designs using advanced CAD- and CAE tools.



If you have a background in the automotive industry, that’s a plus! We are looking for a versatile engineer who can bring diverse skills and perspectives to our team and provide support needed outside their own function.



Our Engineering Site, focuses on semi-active suspension controlled by an electronic valve. The semi-active shock absorber can adapt its behavior during the compression and rebound cycles in real time, resulting in a premium ride experience controlled by the driver.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Perform 3D simulations using ANSYS Fluent and Mechanical.
* Perform Finite Element Analysis using ANSYS Mechanical.
* Perform 1D CFD simulation using AMESIM.
* Perform 2D and 3D modelling in CATIA V5 and SAP (PLM software).
* Prepare detailed reports and presentations on analysis results.
* Stay updated with the latest CAE technologies and methodologies.
* Work in cross-functional project teams delivering high-quality products for global automotive leaders.


**Qualifications:**


* Minimum Bachelor's degree in a relevant field of Engineering.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in simulation, preferably with ANSYS or AMESim.
* Fluent in **English and Swedish.**
* Experience in automotive industry standards and practices desired.
* Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or MATLAB desired.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer E-mob/ICE Thermal Management
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.  


At Thermal & Software, Product Quality, the customer is at the center. Together with colleagues at our department, we are responsible for thermal management for electrified and ICE vehicles. We are also responsible for the software for propulsion batteries. Our mission is to optimize the customer experience. Currently we are looking for one design engineer to join our team, will you take the chance to join this exciting journey?

Your assignment

As a design engineer within thermal management, you will be handling field quality assignments as well as product deviations found at our production units. Through close cooperation with colleagues from eg. R&D, Production and Purchasing, you will support the production flow and introduce product improvements within our areas of responsibility.  


Thermal management covers climatization of electric propulsion systems, as well as cooling systems for internal combustion engines. Your assignment will offer a variety of challenges within our complete portfolio, reaching from mature high volume products to the latest electrified vehicles. Typical tasks can be root cause investigations, updating 3d-models and drawings, publishing engineering change orders and technical documentation.

Your profile

You are a dedicated team-player who thrive in a dynamic, fast paced work environment. You are goal oriented and well-structured in your work. You enjoy taking initiatives yourself when there are no instructions available, and get energy from finding the best way forward in cooperation with others. You have at least 3 years of experience from working as a mechanical design engineer.  


You have a Master’s degree within mechanical engineering.

We offer

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.  


Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.  



Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-18. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.  



For more information  

Get in contact with Head of Product Follow Up, fadi.ibrahim@scania.com  


**We look forward to your application!**

title: Fuel System Test Engineer, XPI Fuel System, Cummins Scania XPI Engineering
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.  

The Södertälje office has grown both in personnel and capability over the last few years and we are at the moment roughly 30 employees, working in 3 separate groups. We are now looking to add an engineer within fuel system testing to the System Performance and Integration team (DIXP).**Job Responsibilities**

As a Fuel System Test Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to operate pump and injector test rigs to deliver high-quality data to our product development teams. You will work with both established testing procedures and custom-developed methods tailored to specific requirements.  

In the event of test issues, you will also be involved in failure investigations related to the rig systems. You will act as our representative at the Scania Fuel System Testing department, working closely with engineers and technicians in that team.  



Additionally, you will collaborate with our colleagues in Columbus, USA—especially the rig testing group—who will provide technical support and guidance for your day-to-day work. Building and maintaining strong working relationships within the global Cummins and Scania fuel systems organizations will be key to your success in this role. Occasional travel to the USA will be required for relationship-building and training purposes.  

As we are a small team based in Södertälje, we value a collaborative mindset. We both ask for and offer help as needed, and depending on your skills and interests, you may also be assigned additional tasks to support your colleagues.**Who You Are**

We are looking for you, who loves a hands-on job and to share your expertise within a multi-functional team, as well as working on your tasks on your own. You understand the importance of creating good relations, and enjoy collaborating with people both locally and globally. You approach your assignments with an analytical mindset and thorough execution, while paying attention to details. Helping a team member, or reaching out for help comes naturally for you, even though it might be slightly outside our role as test engineer.  


* You have an engineering degree or at least 3 years for relevant work experience within automotive testing. Experience from operating fuel system and/or engine testing rigs is considered a strong merit.
* You are comfortable using standard software interfaces for controlling the test environment, e.g. Vision and/or INCA.
* You enjoy working in a lab environment, and to work directly with rig hardware and systems including sensors and measurement system, hydraulic system, controllers, electrical system etc.
* You have excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English
**This Is Us**

For the last 20 years, Scania has partnered with Cummins Engine Company in a joint venture to develop and manufacture common rail fuel systems. Today this fuel system, known as XPI, is used extensively on both Scania and Cummins engine platforms. The main product development site for the high-pressure pump and fuel injectors used in the XPI system is located at Cummins Fuel Systems in Columbus, USA and since 2017 a product development and product support office has been established at Scania in Södertälje to allow for a closer cooperation with current and future European customers and suppliers. Being located at Scania has further developed our collaboration with the Scania R&D organization, allowing us to jointly develop and tailor future fuel systems for customers within the Traton organization. We operate with a large degree of autonomy and have responsibility for an exciting portfolio of fuel system development projects.  



If you are looking for an opportunity to be part of a unique collaboration within a global organization, where we focus on teamwork, our people and developing world class products for our customers – this is your chance. We offer an open climate, where everyone’s contribution is appreciated and encouraged. Even though we are a relatively small organization, we have a lot of experience and wide-reaching responsibilities. We have substantial freedom and autonomy to decide how we get things done and are committed to delivering excellence in everything we do.**Scania Offers**

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.**Application**

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.  

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-17. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.  



If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:  

Niclas Wiker (Manager DIXP) on 070 081 3030 for further information.  



We look forward to your application!

title: Integration Engineers
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Vi förstärker nu våra I&V team med integratörer! Här får du en unik möjligheten att bygga bred kompetens och förståelse för C2 systemet och våra egenutvecklade applikationer. Avdelningen har som uppdrag att digitalisera det markbaserade slagfältet, och sektionen ansvarar för integration och test av våra system i olika faser.
   

  

 Det kommer även finnas möjlighet att arbeta med kund-demos och internationella samarbeten. Som Integratör får du en unik möjlighet i att bygga bred förståelse för vårt system och dess applikationer.
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta i ett team med engagerade, ambitiösa och glada kollegor där ni tillsammans utvecklar innovativa och effektiva arbetssätt för integration, test och verifiering. Rollen innefattar att kontinuerligt förbättra processer och driva arbetssätten framåt.
   

  

 Vi växer så det knakar, och hos oss finns stora möjligheter för dig att utvecklas – oavsett om du vill fördjupa din expertis eller utforska nya områden. Ta chansen att bli en del av vårt team och bidra till teknik i framkant!
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Järfälla men kommer under Q4 2025/Q1 2026 att flytta till Solna Strand.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har något eller några års erfarenhet. Du har en stark teknisk förståelse inom system- och mjukvaruteknik, gärna grundad på en universitets- eller militärexamen.
   

  

 Har du en bakgrund inom programmering, gärna i Python, Powershell, Bat och C++/C#, är det meriterande.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter egenskaper som kvalitetsmedvetenhet, vilja att ständigt jobba med förbättringar samt en analytisk förmåga att se helheten. Vi ser gärna att du trivs med att arbeta i team men har samtidigt förmågan att ta egna initiativ och bidra där det behövs. Du har en strukturerad och lösningsorienterad inställning och trivs i en dynamisk miljö där du både driver utveckling och samarbetar med andra för att nå gemensamma mål.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplaceringkan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25 500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i Business Unit Digital Battlespace Solutions (DBS) och Product Unit C2. Vi är experter på C4I (Command, Control, Communication, and Computer Information System), som är ett av Saabs kärnområden.
   

  

 Inom Land-avdelningen är vår kärnverksamhet att digitalisera det markbaserade slagfältet. Våra C4I-lösningar tillämpar avancerad IT-säkerhet och integrationsteknik i kombination med Military-off-the-shelf(MOTS) hårdvara och mjukvarupaket. Våra slutanvändare finns representerade på alla ledningsnivåer (från grupp- till högkvartersnivå) och i alla förbandsfunktioner (t.ex. mekaniserade förband, artilleri-, underrättelse-, logistik- och CBRN-styrkor).
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer E-mob/ICE Thermal Management
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 At Thermal & Software, Product Quality, the customer is at the center. Together with colleagues at our department, we are responsible for thermal management for electrified and ICE vehicles. We are also responsible for the software for propulsion batteries. Our mission is to optimize the customer experience. Currently we are looking for one design engineer to join our team, will you take the chance to join this exciting journey?
   

  

 Your assignment
   

  

 As a design engineer within thermal management, you will be handling field quality assignments as well as product deviations found at our production units. Through close cooperation with colleagues from eg. R&D, Production and Purchasing, you will support the production flow and introduce product improvements within our areas of responsibility.
   

  

 Thermal management covers climatization of electric propulsion systems, as well as cooling systems for internal combustion engines. Your assignment will offer a variety of challenges within our complete portfolio, reaching from mature high volume products to the latest electrified vehicles. Typical tasks can be root cause investigations, updating 3d-models and drawings, publishing engineering change orders and technical documentation.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 You are a dedicated team-player who thrive in a dynamic, fast paced work environment. You are goal oriented and well-structured in your work. You enjoy taking initiatives yourself when there are no instructions available, and get energy from finding the best way forward in cooperation with others. You have at least 3 years of experience from working as a mechanical design engineer.
   

  

 You have a Master’s degree within mechanical engineering.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-18. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 For more information
   

  

 Get in contact with Head of Product Follow Up, fadi.ibrahim@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Senior ML Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We’re looking for Founding ML Engineers who will shape how we fine-tune, serve, and evaluate LLMs and frontier models in production - and help define what it means to build a truly lovable AI product.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Led or contributed to cutting-edge LLM research at top AI labs / globally leading tech startups
* Trained and fine-tuned LLMs on large-scale code, language, or multimodal datasets
* Deep understanding of transformer architectures, attention mechanisms, and model optimization
* Shipped ML systems in production, with real users and real uptime
* Built fast, production-level systems while maintaining strong practices around reproducibility, monitoring, and model performance
* You hold somewhat strong opinions about model safety, latency and helpfulness, but aren’t afraid to experiment


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence** 
 : Train, tune, and scale frontier LLMs that power lovable products.
   

  

* Own training pipelines for LLMs, from data curation to evaluation and deployment
* Fine-tune models on high-quality, domain-specific data (code, natural language, product usage signals)
* Work closely with product engineers to integrate models into real user-facing features
* Build retrieval pipelines, evaluation frameworks, and experimentation tools
* Push the limits of what’s possible with current/upcoming open models, and help define what we should train next


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* DevOps & Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, observability, infra-as-code


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an intro call with the team.
* Complete the take-home exercise
* Show us how you approach problems during two technical interviews
* Join us for trial work lasting 2 days preferably on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal
